definition: (of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions

sentences.english: Shortly thereafter, financial institutions hit the skids in rapid succession.
sentences.chinese: 此后不久，金融机构接二连三地出现触礁。

sentences.english: So does that mean that every troubled marriage should be saved?
sentences.chinese: 以上结论是否意味着人们要挽救每段触礁的婚姻吗？

sentences.english: Boats often pile up on the rocks in the shallow water.
sentences.chinese: 船常常在浅水处触礁搁浅。

sentences.english: The ship struck a rock at the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船在进港时触礁了。

sentences.english: They used fake signal lights to bait the enemy ships onto the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 他们用假信号灯诱使敌船触礁。

sentences.english: MengFei and Chen hit again feelings.
sentences.chinese: 孟菲和陈超感情再度触礁。

sentences.english: Love On The Rocks For Justin And Selena？
The boat struck and bedded down.
Many a ship has been wrecked on those rucks.
sentences.chinese: 许多艘船只都触礁毁坏了。

sentences.english: She blamed the failure of their marriage on him.
sentences.chinese: 她把婚姻的触礁归咎于他。

sentences.english: The beauty of the music produced by the Sirens of ancient Greek legend drew unwary sailors to their doom on the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 古希腊的妖妇用优美的歌声勾引水手触礁而死。

sentences.english: And Warship Zhenyuan was wounded after striking a reef and it finally surrendered and put into Japanese Navy.
sentences.chinese: 而镇远则因触礁受损，最后投降编入日本海军。

definition: to capsize/(fig.) to suffer a setback or defeat
to fall into the ocean/to crash into the ocean
to be stranded (of ship)/to run aground/fig. to run into difficulties and stop
lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
(of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
